job_title: José E. Serrano Educational Partnership Program with Minority Serving Institutions (EPP/MSI) – Undergraduate Scholar
clearance_req: U.S. citizen or U.S. national; enrollment at accredited MSI; background and eligibility verification
salary_compensation: Up to $45,000 total award over 2 years; includes academic-year support, bi-weekly stipend, summer internship stipend (~$700/week), housing allowance (~$300/week), and travel
desig_age_grd: Undergraduate (rising junior or 4th year in 5-year program)
duty_station: NOAA facilities nationwide (summer internships); home institution during academic year
responsiblities_sum: Full-time undergraduate study during academic year; complete two paid NOAA summer internships; participate in hands-on research, data collection, and NOAA mission-related projects under NOAA mentors; maintain communication and reporting requirements.
desired_education_sum: Enrollment full-time at an accredited Minority Serving Institution; major related to NOAA mission sciences; minimum 3.2 cumulative GPA; rising junior or equivalent.
req_skills_sum: Basic scientific research skills; data collection; communication; time management; adherence to research protocols.
pref_skills_sum: Prior research experience; interest in NOAA science, policy, or technology careers.
work_conditions_sum: Academic-year study plus full-time summer internships; office, lab, and potential field settings; must comply with NOAA safety and conduct requirements.
application_components: Online application via NOAA Office of Education system; transcripts; essays; references.
poss_project: NOAA mission-related science, engineering, and policy projects
poss_transport: Yes (round-trip travel to internship sites covered)
poss_professdev: Professional development workshops; NOAA mentoring; conference/workshop participation
pert_details_sum: Highly competitive national scholarship; focuses on diversifying NOAA workforce; includes structured mentoring and internships.
